title: `minidftatom` Roadmap
body:
*Original issue*: https://gitlab.com/lfortran/lfortran/-/issues/401

Here is a roadmap for `minidftatom`: https://gitlab.com/lfortran/examples/minidftatom

A restricted subset to explore AST->ASR issues and fixes.

# Parser

Tested implicitly by the AST transform.

# AST

Everything parses to AST and back to source code and it seems to produce identical results when compiled with gfortran (all tests pass).

One can apply the src -> AST -> src transformation as follows:
```bash
cd minidftatom
# -i --> Inplace modification
for file in *.f90; do lfortran fmt -i $file; done
```
Make sure to enable long lines with `-ffree-line-length-none`.
# ASR
This follows the same logic as https://gitlab.com/lfortran/lfortran/-/issues/313. Compile each module with `lfortran -c blah.f90 -o blah.o` and write out (manually) a dependency tree. A task made much easier with `fortdepend`.
